Rivadavia 1917, C1033AAJ, Buenos Aires, Argentina Olefi ns oxidation on Cu-M(x), synthesized by TIE method, using H 2 O 2 has been studied. Reaction mechanism including the interaction of the catalyst with H 2 O 2 was proposed. -Pinene conversions reached values around 23% being verbenone the major product. Optimal reaction conditions were: -pinene/oxidant of 4/1 with a further H 2 O 2 addition. The recycling studies did not show loss in activity and selectivity. Selective epoxidation of olefi ns over Co(II)-Schiff base immobilised on KIT-6 P. Visuvamithiran, M. Palanichamy, K. Shanthi, V. Murugesan Department of Chemistry, Anna University, Chennai 600025, India Covalent anchoring of Co(II)-Salen complex onto KIT-6 was synthesised. Selective epoxidation of olefi ns over Co-S-KIT-6 using H 2 O 2 as the oxidant was reported. Solvent polarity played a crucial role for the conversion and product selectivity. The Co-S-KIT-6 can be easily recovered and recycled for fi ve cycles. Applied Catalysis A: General, 462â€“463 (2013) 46 Applied Catalysis A: General, 462â€“463 (2013) 23 Contents v A comparison of Ni/SiC and Ni/Al 2 O 3 catalyzed total methana- tion for production of synthetic natural gas Guoquan Zhang a,b , Tianjun Sun a , Jiaxi Peng a , Sheng Wang a , Shudong Wang a a Dalian National Laboratory for Clean Energy, Dalian Institute of Chemical Physics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Dalian 116023, Liaoning, China b University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing 100039, China Ni/SiC was compared to Ni/Al 2 O 3 in the total methanation reaction for the fi rst time. The 120 h stability tests showed Ni/SiC was more stable than Ni/Al 2 O 3 . Neither sintering nor carbon deposition occurred on the Ni/SiC catalyst. The Ni/Al 2 O 3 catalyst suffered from sintering and carbon deposition. The Ni/SiC catalyst was easier to regenerate than the Ni/Al 2 O 3 catalyst. Bhethanabotla Department of Chemical and Biomedical Engineering, University of South Florida, Tampa, FL, United States The effect of Pt and Ru promoters on C deposition on Co catalyst is explored using DFT. Applied Catalysis A: General, 462â€“463 (2013) 168 Polymer-supported titanium dioxide photocatalysts for environmental remediation: A review Seema Singh, Hari Mahalingam, Pramod Kumar Singh Department of Chemical Engineering, Jaypee University of Engineering and Technology, Guna, Madhya Pradesh, India We review various polymer supports reported for use in TiO 2 photocatalysis. Preparation methods, photocatalytic activity and the reuse of polymer- supported TiO 2 photocatalysts have been discussed. Polymer-supported buoyant photocata- lysts effective in visible and/or solar light is a promising area of recent research. Biodegradable polymer-supported TiO 2 photocatalysts needs further investigation. Challenges to be overcome in the commercialization of polymer-supported TiO2photocatalysts. [NaBH 4 ]/[pnp] ratio is optimized to be 16.7 for p-nitrophenol conversion. Rate of the reaction is found to be faster (3.63 Ã— 10 âˆ’3 s âˆ’1 ) with the composition Sr 4.99 Cu 0.01 (PO 4 ) 3 OH. Applied Catalysis A: General, 462â€“463 (2013) 262 Contents xi Analysis of the reaction network for the Rh-catalyzed hydroformylation of 1-dodecene in a thermomorphic multicomponent solvent system J. Markert a , Y. Brunsch b , T. Munkelt a , G. Kiedorf c , A. Behr b , C. Hamel a,c , A. Seidel-Morgenstern a,c a Otto von Guericke University, Institute of Process Engineering, UniversitÃ¤tsplatz 2, 39106 Magdeburg, Germany b Technical University Dortmund, Chair of Technical Chemistry, Emil-Figge-Strasse 66, 44227 Dortmund, Germany c Max Planck Institute for Dynamics of Complex Technical Systems, Sandtorstrasse 1, 39106 Magdeburg, Germany The hydroformylation of 1-dodecene was studied in a TMS system. A suitable solvent and catalyst systems were determined. Semi-batch experiments including perturbations were performed. The main branches of the reaction network could be identifi ed. For this reaction network a corresponding catalytic cycle is suggested. Applied Catalysis A: General, 462â€“463 (2013) 287 Theoretical study of selective hydrogenation in a mixture of acetylene and ethylene over Fe@W(1 1 1) bimetallic surfaces Chun-Chih Chang, Chen-Hao Yeh, Jia-Jen Ho Department of Chemistry, National Taiwan Normal University, 88, Section 4, Tingchow Road, Taipei 116, Taiwan The presence of Fe atoms on W(1 1 1) surface could decrease the desorption energies of C 2 H 4 , resulting in the increase of catalyst selectivity. Fe(1,2)@W(1 1 1) surface exhibits a superior catalytic property for acetylene to be directly hydrogenated to ethylene, and ethylene could be desorbed directly from the surface. Replacing the traces of Fe atoms on the W(1 1 1) surface can suppress the reactivity of C C bond scission and facilitate partial hydrogena- tion of C 2 H 2 to C 2 H 4 . Applied Catalysis A: General, 462â€“463 (2013) 296 Synthesis of HZSM-5 coatings on the inner surface of stainless steel tubes and their catalytic performance in n-dodecane cracking Li Wang a , Ying Wang a , Jiangge Hao a , Guozhu Liu a , Xuesong Ma b , Shenlin Hu b a Key Laboratory of Green Chemical Technology of Ministry of Education, School of Chemical Engineering and Technology, Tianjin University, Tianjin 300072, China b Science and Technology on Scramjet Laboratory, Beijing 100074, China The thickness of HZSM-5 layers can be manipulated by changing the growth time. Synergy between thickness and diffusivity of HZSM-5 layer determines ZSR performance. A non-compact microstructure is necessary for catalytic active zeolite coatings. ENEA Frascati, Via E. Fermi 45, 00044 Frascati, RM, Italy Pt(0.6 wt%)/La 2 O 3 (27 wt%)Â·SiO 2 is active, stable, selective, non carbon forming. The Pt dispersion did not change after exposure to the WGS reacting stream. The stability is not affected by start-up/shut-down cycles under WGS reaction. High CO conversions (97%) and hydrogen recoveries (92%) were achieved.
